questions.text: Full Name
Email Address
Phone Number
Date of Birth
questions.disqualifyMessage: You must be 18 years or older to use this service.

questions.text: What state do you live in?
Gender
Are you currently pregnant, trying to get pregnant, or breastfeeding?
questions.disqualifyMessage: For the safety of you and your baby, GLP-1 medications are not recommended during pregnancy, while trying to conceive, or while breastfeeding.

questions.text: Height (feet and inches)
Weight (pounds)
questions.disqualifyMessage: Our GLP-1 program is designed for individuals with a BMI of 25 or higher. We recommend discussing other wellness approaches with your healthcare provider.

questions.text: Have you ever had an adverse or allergic reaction to any GLP-1 receptor agonist?
questions.disqualifyMessage: For your safety, we cannot prescribe GLP-1 medications if you have had an allergic reaction to this type of medication before.

questions.text: Do you have any of the following medical conditions?
questions.disqualifyMessage: Based on your medical history, GLP-1 medications may not be safe for you. We recommend discussing weight management options with your healthcare provider.

questions.text: Are you taking any of the following medications?
questions.disqualifyMessage: Your current medications may interact with GLP-1 therapy. Please work with your prescribing doctor to explore safe weight management options that won't interfere with your current treatment.

questions.text: Do you currently have a known HbA1C >8%?
questions.disqualifyMessage: Your current HbA1C level requires specialized diabetes care. We recommend working with an endocrinologist or your primary care doctor for the best treatment approach.

questions.text: Do you have family history of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 2 or Medullary Thyroid Carcinoma?
questions.disqualifyMessage: Due to your family history of thyroid conditions, GLP-1 medications carry additional risks for you. Please consult with an endocrinologist about safer alternatives.

questions.text: Are you currently receiving chemotherapy?
questions.disqualifyMessage: While receiving cancer treatment, it's important to focus on your current therapy. Please discuss weight management goals with your oncology team when appropriate.

questions.text: Do you have any allergies to medications, foods, or other substances?
How much alcohol do you typically consume?
questions.disqualifyMessage: Regular heavy alcohol consumption can interact dangerously with GLP-1 medications. We recommend discussing safer weight management options with your healthcare provider.

questions.text: Do you currently use tobacco or vape?
What type of tobacco/vaping products and how frequently?
What is your exercise level?
Are you currently experiencing depression with history of suicidal attempts, thoughts, or ideation?
questions.disqualifyMessage:
We care about your safety.
Because you indicated that you are feeling depressed or having thoughts of suicide, you are not eligible to continue with this program/medication at this time.
You are not alone, and help is available:
• Call or text 988 to connect with the Suicide & Crisis Lifeline.
• If you are in immediate danger of harming yourself, call 911 or go to the nearest Emergency Department.
Please reach out to a trusted family member, friend, or mental health professional today.
Your wellbeing is our top priority.

questions.text: Upload full-body photos
Upload government ID (driver's license) for identity verification
